fields.description: We have created a customized workflow, where we have added additional steps. As far as we can see it is not possible to customize the icon (graphic) for the new Linked statuses. We would appreciate this functionality.
fields.summary: Customize icon for Linked Status

fields.description:
If you try to move an issue from a proyect to another, despite the issue is not assigned to any user, if you don't have permissions to assign in the target proyect, an error is showed and you are not allowed to move the issue.

I suppose that if the issue is not still assigned, this permission should not be heeded, should it?

Regards,

Andrés.
fields.summary: Move Issues Bug

fields.description:
I have a problem with Internet Explorer 6.0. I've installed Jira standalone 3.1 Enteprise Edition on a HPUX Server. I can't login with IE6.0 when I connect to Jira by the server hostname. I insert userID and passwd (valid user and passwd) but jira always return to me login page. If I insert a wrong user or passwd, Jira tell me that the user or passwd is wrong. If I connect by Ip address the login is successfull.

I have changed some settings of IE but the problem remain.

Thx

daniele
fields.summary: Unable to login with Internet Explorer 6.0

fields.description:
Hello,

If I create new issue and forgot  fill in mandatory item (ex. Description), JIRA return warning.
If I fill in Attachment, in next screen is lost (please see screen shots).

I know. Input type file is unaccessible for server and JavaScript, but server know if item is fill and you can write warnig: "Sorry, Your attachment is lost. Please fill in again!".

Thank you, for comments.
fields.summary: Lost attachment
RPC plugin does not work with jdk 1.3

fields.description:
It looks a lot as though JIRA 3.1.1 is refetching and parsing the CVS log on every request. While the CVS operation is proceeding, the invoking thread blocks, and other requests queue up (presumably triggering another parse when they complete).

This can be seen by watching the log file on the server.  It will be stable when no requests are being processed, will immediately truncate to 0 bytes when a request comes in.  Attached is a thread dump of the subsequent CVS parse.
fields.summary: CVS log fetched and parsed once per request
Update XML-RPC/SOAP docs

  {panel}

Quick search is ok, but 95% of my searchs are for one project, and typing the little keyword everytime I search is getting annoying.

How about a Dashboard widget that acts just like Quick Search but only works on one project?

Thanks,
Brandon Philips

fields.description:
When I uset the 'Find Issue' function, I get a number of issues but without any columns displayed.

There is an option to go to the Issue navigator but I am not able to select any column because the list of values is empty.

This happens since I added two custom fields.

I've checked your Database and I found that Issue JIRA-4896 is related to the same issue.

In that issue they talk about 'Issue profiling' set to on and a lot of technical stuff that I don't really understand; I don't find any parameters related to 'issue profiling'.

I need some help.

Best regards.
Fabiano Gaiga.
fields.summary: Issue navigator is empty
Widths of issue navigator columns controlled by CSS style sheet

We arer now using JIRA accross the whole organisation and I am trying to configure my daskboard to show statitics for JIRA projects owned by my team only. This is not possible currently, as you can only select one project or all projects.

When choosing from LOV (List of Values) to assign user to issue, the expected list of users from which to choose does not appear.

Just upgraded from v 2.6 to v 3.1.1 last evening.

Charlie ;)
3/17/05 11:52 a.m. MST
fields.summary: user picker and assign to drop down not showing users

fields.description:
Lucene doesn't support prefix search.

We have created some issues with following titles:
 - "ComponentComboBox"
 - "TableComboBox"
 - "DateComboBox"
 - "JXComboBox"

these words also occur in attached commented and file attachments with java source code
 In our projects we need to search for the word "ComboBox" or "Box" or just "box", but it does not retrieve the issues mentioned above.

Is it possible to extend JIRA search capabiltiy with a simple search plugin, which returns results like String's indexOf ? Of course, this will result in neg. performance issues. 
 But I think, this way of searching is practical for us, when searching for more abstract words / partialparts of words in jira/confluence.

*Cause*

We use [lucene|https://lucene.apache.org/core/] as for our search engine. I did some research and it looks like Lucene starting at version 2.1 does support leading wild cards. You can see [here|http://wiki.apache.org/lucene-java/LuceneFAQ?highlight=%28leading%29%7C%28wildcard%29#What_wildcard_search_support_is_available_from_Lucene.3F] via Apache's FAQ. We don't currently use this function. As you can see even Apache mentions it's an expensive operation.

*Work Around*

We recommend [Script Runner|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner] a third party add on (Add is no longer free) . Script Runner really beefs up JQL as you can use regex with script runner.
{noformat}
For example: issueFunction in issueFieldMatch("project = JRA", "description", "ABC\\d{4}").  {noformat}
See more on IssueFieldMatch [here|https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/wiki/display/GRV/Scripted+JQL+Functions#ScriptedJQLFunctions-issueFieldMatch%28subquery,fieldname,regexp%29].
fields.summary: Allow searching for part of a word (prefix / substring searches)

fields.description:
I want to configure the Issue Navigator in order to see some specific fields, which are important to me to be included in printed summaries.

As far as only default fields are involved, the behavior is OK. But the custom fields I want to add simply are not there when I go to the navigator again, not in the browser view neither in the printable view. 

When I go back to the "configure" page, the custom field is there, even if I log out and get in again.
fields.summary: Cannot see custom fields in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
The Excel report does not contain any reference to linked or sub- tasks when an export is made.  This is annoying as it does not accurately reflect the current state of issue.

Please aadvise how we can add functionality to ensure that the "sub-task" field is viewed and can be populated in JIRA.  Similarly, for linked tasks, it would be highly useful to have a list of linked tasks included in the Excel output
fields.summary: Show subtasks in excel view
Show version description on roadmap and change log.

fields.description:
Is it just me that can't find the link...

I would like to be notified every time you release a new JIRA version. I guess there is a mailing list that i can sign up to...

But where...? :-)
fields.summary: Notification of new JIRA released

fields.description:
Just noticed that if the issue summary includes < and >'s that they don't show up (nor anything inside them) in the road map view.  Don't know if this is a problem anywhere else.

i.e. a summary like "Add information on <CS_DebugVerbose> to docs" shows up as "Add information on to docs" in the roadmap view.  When I actually view the issue the summary shows up fine.

No biggie, doesn't bother me, but thought I should report it.

Jon
fields.summary: adding less than or greater than in the issue summary doesn't display on road map page

fields.summary: Possible JDBC (database) connection leak

fields.description:
Consider the following scenario.  (This is exactly what happened to us and not a contrived scenario)

JIRA is installed in a production location and everything is just peachy.

A new release of JIRA is available and so it is installed in a sandbox area for test driving purposes.  Data for this sandbox instance is obtained from the aforementioned production instance, i.e. you export from production and import into the sandbox.

A big error has crept in!

The data in the JIRA tables includes the location of the backups, attachments and indices.  So, unwittingly, the sandbox instance is pointing at the same location as production for backups, attachments and indexes.

You notice this and proceed to update the index location for the sandbox instance to a sandbox location.

Gradually the users are increasingly insistent that JIRA (on production) isn't working.  Filters are throwing exceptions and the like.

You start piecing together apparently disconnected information and deduce the cause:
The reason for this is that when you changed the location of the index in the sandbox instance, JIRA-sandbox first blew away the indexes at the old location before creating it at the new location.  AAAARRRRGGGHHH!

Now, the title of this issue should make sense.
fields.summary: Ability to change index location without clobbering old location

fields.description:
Custom fields on the issue navigator screen is unordered.

Should at least be alphabetical
fields.summary: Custom fields on the issue navigator screen is unordered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6207].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 20 September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

While this suggestion has gathered significant interest, we're unable to implement all of the excellent suggestions you make. We don't plan to work on this for the foreseeable future. This suggestion will be reviewed in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status. The change requires an architecture change that may negatively affect other product areas.

After careful review of the most pressing needs of our customers, we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, some of them including your highly voted suggestions:

Further performance and stability improvements
 * Adding the "updated-by" JQL search query JRASERVER-1973
 * Support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection JRASERVER-36135
 * Jira email notifications batching JRASERVER-1369
 * Mobile app for Jira Server JRASERVER-46149
 * Email notifications template editor available from the UI JRASERVER-7266
 * Improved filter and dashboard management by Jira administrators JRASERVER-15900 and JRASERVER-41269

In the recent Jira Server releases we have shipped some highly-voted features and improvements, including:
 * Filters and dashboards collaborative editing
 * Selectable delimiters in CSV export 
 * Microsoft SQL Server 2016 support 
 * iPv6 support
 * Faster Kanban boards
 * Refreshed projects and custom fields management pages in the admin's section 

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our approach to highly voted server suggestions here.

To learn more on how you suggestions are reviewed, see our updated workflow for server feature suggestions.

Kind regards,
 Jira Server Product Management
{panel}
h3. *Original request description*

In certain circumstances, it would be useful if JIRA's email notifications included attachments, and a new "Attachment added" notification existed to notify users of attachments made to a page (and mail them the added attachment). Whether to mail attachments should be a per-user option.
h3. *Workaround*

There are some third-party plugins that allows users to embed attachment file into the email notification, please refer to the following Answer Threads:
 * [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/12277565/sending-attachments-through-service-desk] - [Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/cloud/overview]
 * [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9371717/how-do-i-include-attachments-in-jira-notification-emails] - [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview]
fields.summary: Include attachments or link to attachments in notification emails
Email Handler should be able to reference multiple projects

fields.description: Attach screenshot images are unclear when viewed in JIRA.  Is there a reason or a workaround for this?
fields.summary: Attach Screenshots are unclear when viewed
Investigate logging stats (free mem, users etc) with custom log4j appender

fields.description:
Currently, if you go to search, after browsing a project, you have to select that project again.

I'm not sure what should happen if you hit 'new'?  Probably default back to all?
fields.summary: When using IssueNavigator on new search, default to the current project, instead of all projects

fields.description: You should be able to add "Project Name" (not just the keys, which let's face it, are meaningless) to the list of fields when you're browsing a project.  This would probably require only a few lines of code, and would be invaluable.
fields.summary: Project Column in Issues Views

fields.description:
It should be possible to create custom fields for Projects as well as Issues.  For example, in my company we'd find it very useful to create fields such as "Brand", "Product Manager", "Customer(s)" (we usually only have one or a few per project), "Platform", and a bunch of others I won't bore you with.

You should also be able to search, create reports and group issues based on these fields.
fields.summary: Custom fields for Projects

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

   When you're browsing a project, in the right side of the page there's a section for priorities. This summary shows the right data, but when you click en one of the priorities, it shows issues in this priority for all projects, not just for the one you have clicked on.

   Regards,

   Andrés.
fields.summary: Browse Project Error
Possibility to attachment screendump at issue creation time

fields.description:
If you create a filter using an specific field (status, for example), and then use the portlets Statistics or TwoDimensionalStatistic to show this filter using the same field you chose to create filter, the information the portlet shows is right, but when you click in one of the links (any status, in the example), it will show you not only that state, but all of them.

I've looked for this bug in jira.atlassian.com and I've found someones similar, but not this. 

Regards,

Andrés.
fields.summary: Statistics and Two Dimensional Statistics error

fields.summary: Bug with Project Statistics on Dashboard

fields.description:
POP Service occasionally does not create issue / comments from e-mails

This causes comments to be lost. It seems to also create it once the server has been restarted. This needs some investigation
fields.summary: POP Service occasionally does not create issue / comments from e-mails

fields.description: I installed the evaluation version of the standalone JIRA and the installation defaulted to Danish. This caused an error and a stacktrace to be shown on the frontpage. When switching to English the stack trace dissapeared.
fields.summary: Error on dashboard when running with Danish text

fields.description:
CreateIssueHandler blows up when the body of an e-mail is greater than 4k in length.
JIRA attempts to put the e-mail body into the description field, when
saved Oracle complains because it cannot e-mails longer than 4k.  E-Mail
is not processed.

Since this only affects Oracle users, I'm not sure what the best way to
fix this would be.  Some solutions could be:

1. text is truncated
2. text is truncated, body of message is attached.
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler fails for e-mails greater than 4k

fields.description: The component filter for a list of issues does not sort the list by component.
fields.summary: Sorting of Component Issue Filter does not work properly

fields.description:
Ctrl Enter in a TextAreas should submit the form.

Makes using JIRA through the keyboard much easier
fields.summary: Ctrl Enter in a TextAreas should submit the form

fields.description:
I have several issues with the phrase "KidVantage" in the description. Performing a search on "KidVantage" or ""Kidvantage" finds 9 issues. However, searching on "k*vantage" find no issues. Likewise, "kid*vantage" finds no issues. 
Again, "ki?vantage" finds no matches. The help on query syntax says "*" can be used as a wildcard if not in the start position:
"You can also use the wildcard searches in the middle of a term. For example, to search for Win95 or Windows95 you can use the search "wi*95"."
It would seem wildcards aren't working.
fields.summary: wildcard search fails to find matches

fields.description:
I added a column to display a custom field in my issue navigator.
When I navigate through preset filters, I'm able to see the column.
If I browse the project and choose any of the preset filters for open issues by assignee, the column doesn't show. If I click on "configure your issue navigator", the column is displayed and the sample data does show the right value.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Inconsistency
Separate View & Create Permissions For Attachments

fields.description:
The bug tip is "script error,line 67 and charactor 87,url:http://localhost:8080/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa "
The encoding is utf-8,by the way,the chinese calendar-zh.js has error yet!

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5172?page=comments
fields.summary: Javascript error occurs with DatePicker for Chinese locale

fields.description:
I created a worfklow transition with event "Issue Commented" instead of generic event and a transitition view with "Add comment and Assign".

If I use this transition without entering any comment (leave textfield blank), a Velocity exception is thrown (see attachment). The notification mail contains the same stacktrace. 

If one use the same transition and enters a comment, eveything work as expected.
fields.summary: Issue commented event in a workflow transition does not allow empty comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6182].
  {panel}

Hi,

we are looking for using JIRA for tracking our Changes. Change-Management as a (custom) workflow needs two key features ... 

(1) approvements
I think of a custom field (designed like a (radio) button in html forms) where you can (hit) approve or (hit) decline and assigning the issue to next group of approvements.

(2) assigning groups
Using groups of users in workflow transitions where one of a group approves or declines and assign issues to them.

Trying to set up a custom workflow for realizing a Change Managemen project I stopped at these issues!

Do you know of any plugin for JIRA like
JRA-4697
http://blogs.codehaus.org/people/vmassol/archives/000842_writing_a_jira_3_plugin.html
to customize JIRA for Change Managment/tracking changes??

Regards,

Joerg.
fields.summary: JIRA as a Change Management Application

fields.description:
Hi guys,

   Currently, portlet "Show filters" is not really useful because you can't choose columns to show. You can't even show issue status, what is something really necessary and basic.

   For next release, it will be a great new that you allow this functionality. I look forward for it ;-)

   Regards,

   Andrés.
fields.summary: Column selection for "show filters" portlet

fields.description:
How can I find all items that have a custom field empty?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Search for a custom field that is empty

fields.description:
Can I record the current user for each update that is done on a Jira item?
This would basically sove partially the issues of those looking for the history of work per user.
See JRA-5536, JRA-5470.

I'd like to define a custom field that will be automatically updated upon each chnage with the previous value concatenated with the "Current User"
fields.summary: A new Participants custom field

fields.description: we have a large number of shared filters, and its impossible to have control over your own list of filters -- you're at the mercy of what other people shar. what I'd like is to have is the ability to select a "short list" of filters that I can see, and put them in a "favorite filters" portlet.
fields.summary: shared filters and "favorites"

fields.description:
Bulk edits made on a custom field (Text < 255) are not return by searches done after the edit.

This is the scenario that should repro this bug:
1. Create custom field "Reported By", default value=NA.
2. Do a bulk edit for some (I did 32 then 52) items and set them to NA.
3. Do a search for "Reported By"=NA.
4. No items are returned
5. Re-index Jira
6. Repeat number 4. All items edited are returned.

This is pretty annoying since it requires you to pretty much re-index after each bulk index.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Bulk edits are not searchable without re-indexing

fields.description:
Anyone can reset the password of a user whose ID they know.
Verified on the test system.
fields.summary: Passwords sent as clear text in email

fields.description:
two projects: A & B
Issue A-1 cloned, to A-2
Issue A-2 moved to Project B, becomes B-1
Both issues now show the link A-1 <-> B-1 so far so good

Now, user foo logs in.  Foo has minimal 'jira-user'-type permissions for project B only.
Foo views B-1.
Foo sees Issue linking section, with linking heading/veriage ("cloned from" or whatever), but no actual link or linked issue shown.  The heading informs the user that this was cloned, something they should not know.

Expected result: since no actual links are shown, heading should not show, and in fact the whole links section should not show.
fields.summary: cross-prject issue linking appearance for users with no permission for the linked project

fields.description:
A problem has surfaced in the handling of incoming messages for use with FullComment/NonQuoted message handlers etc.

The problem is that JIRA is not tracking the Message-ID's when it creates the comment inside JIRA for already being processed.

This triggers the comment being processed multiple times.  Normally this isn't a problem with POP3 as the messages would be deleted from the server as their read, but in the case of my NNTP polling service, if the same message is read for any reason, it triggers a new comment....
fields.summary: Message handlers don't track MessageID for dupes

fields.description:
The issue selector shows saved filters and recently viewed issues but we have found this is not quite enough. 

1)
The drop down list should have a "current project" item that displays all issues from the current project the user is in. 

2)
It would also be handy to show the Projects selector list to allow users to select a different project than the one they are currently in.
fields.summary: Issue Selector window not handy enough

fields.description:
me:
Saving the configuration - page doesnt return until log is fetched and parsed.
Ouch.

How about the page return instantly and display a visual cue as to cvs log status (last polled/parsed or error) in the modules listing?
I think the Fisheye model of always show a page, even if data isnt up to date - but show warning to that effect, is a more user-friendly model.

---
anton:
You are right, implementing a background jobs queue is something that
will benefit JIRA in many ways.

---
me:
You want to look at the concurrency utils...
fields.summary: CVS operations (e.g. save/test settings) need to happen as a background task

fields.description:
If I create a new custom field, let's name it "A" with options "1", "2", "3", and "4", I have no way of searching for issues like this:

"All issues which have A with either '1', '2' or '3'"
"All issues where A is not set (is null)"

Now I can only search:
"Issues where A IS 1"
"Issues where A IS 2"
"Issues where A IS 3"
"Issues where A IS 4"
"Issues where A IS ANY"
fields.summary: Radio Buttons should support Select List Searcher template
Commenting by replying to mail should keep mail's original security level

fields.description:
Hello

We are working with the Jira tool to catch new customer support calls. Normally the customers are creating new issues and add comments to them from time to time.

What we really need is a kind of filter or overview where we can see all new comments on the system in a custom period of time. We already tried the updated filter but this provided not the desired results because the new comments and the new issues are mixed up.

If you have any suggestions on this, it would be very useful and would support us in our daily work.

Thanks and Best regards

Axel Hervatin

Airpas Aviation
fields.summary: Filter only new comments

fields.description: We have someone named "Bert Tobé". His mail from JIRA looks like it comes from : =?Cp1252?Q?Bert_Tob=E9_=28JIRA=29?=
fields.summary: Non-ascii characters in mail names result in garbage

fields.description:
The content of section 3.2 is missing from the PDF documentation. In the online (HTML) version of the manual, this corresponds to page http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.1/projects.html
.
fields.summary: Missing section from PDF documentation

fields.description:
When going to http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa selecting anything from combos
"Reported By" or "Assignee", the following javascript error appears:

"processSelectImage is not defined".

The combo changes, though, but the user input field stays grayed out, so you cannot choose the user.


This used to work in 3.0.3 and stopped working when we upgraded to 3.1.

Because of this, the functionality to select users is unavailable!


If you are planning to have this fixed only in 3.2, please tell us at least how to fix it by ourselves.
fields.summary: JavaScript error on "Find issues" page when selecting users

fields.description:
Filter Statistics with Priority as one of its axis does not display the number of issues with No Priority.

This makes the statistics table seem wrong - when you click on the filter name it returns more then the total sum, since issues with no priority are not counted.
fields.summary: 'No Priority' count is not displayed in filter statistics portlet
Add warnings of logical inconsistencies in admin

fields.description:
Floating point and currency fields descriptions wrong for MS SQL

There were no decimal points.
fields.summary: Floating point and currency fields descriptions wrong for MS SQL

fields.description:
From http://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-1078

Essentially have configurable a challenge / response to issue creation in the POP service:

Michael Czeiszperger:
I'm finishing the email gateway, and couldn't find a solution to this dilemma. I'd like users to continue to be able to send email to support@address.com, but that address is being innundated with spam. Incredible amounts of spam. I configured a JIRA email gateway with createusers=false so that spam wouldn't be sucked into JIRA, and only legimate users could create issues. The problem is we don't current require users to be registered, so when we switch this on email to support@address.com from existing users both won't create issues and the user will never be notified of that fact.

So, is there any way of sending email to someone who's not in the system who hits a PopService handler with createusers=false?
fields.summary: Challenge / response to issue creation in the POP service for unregistered users

fields.description:
When logging an hour's work on a 1-week-long issue, the following changelog is generated:

Remaining Estimate  	 1 day, 16 hours [ 144000 ]   	 1 day, 15 hours [ 140400 ]
Time Spent 		1 hour [ 3600 ]

The actual times in seconds (in square brackets) are correct, but the text assumes 24 hour days / 7 day weeks, and is therefore incorrect.  Whatever renders this text should take the actual timetracking settings for hours/day etc into account.
fields.summary: Time tracking estimates in change log assume 24 hour days

fields.description:
The Notifications for 'Stop Progress' is being sent with the wrong 'changed by' user. 
If you start progress on an issue then reassign the issue to another user, the change history correctly notes down the original assignee as the user that stopped progress. However the email sent says that the new assignee has stopped the issue.

For example under the 'Change History' Tab you see:
Change by Test user [10/Mar/05 10:24 AM]
Status 	In Progress [ 3 ] 	Open [ 1 ]

But in the email you recieve:
Work on TST-1 stopped by Administrator
fields.summary: Notfiication sends wrong information for assigning an 'In Progress' Issue

fields.description:
From http://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-363

The sequence number for issue types seems to get mangled causing duplicates. One of the visible results of this is the project statistics portlets suppresses the issue type.

The fix should be two phased:

(1) Make the project stats portlet more "error resistant". Duplicate sequence number should not make the issue type disappear altogether.

(2) Investigate how to replicate this "mangling" of sequence numbers. Likely to be a bug somewhere in the admin code.

I believe (1) should be done as priority and should not be too taxing
fields.summary: The sequence value in issuetype table gets mangled

fields.description:
After importing from Bugzilla we have about 1500 "versions", as we used the version field in Bugzilla to record build numbers :)

AS a result we need to merge versions to actual release versions.

The merge drop-down is not sorted alphanumerically, but rather it is sorted (it seems) by the sequence in whcih the versions were created / imported. This makes it extremely difficult to merge many versions into one.

A simple immediate improvement would be to make the drop-down much "taller" so that 15-20 versions are shown, rather than only 4 at a time.
fields.summary: WHen merging issue, the dro-down select is not sorted alphanumerically
Extend IssueNavigator to allow user-defined views

fields.description:
Here is the exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException at 
com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createAttachments(BugzillaImportBean.java:860) at 
com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createIssues(BugzillaImportBean.java:246) at 
com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.create(BugzillaImportBean.java:169) at 
com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.BugzillaImport.doRun(BugzillaImport.java:140) at
fields.summary: If Bugzilla has no attachments, nullpointer exception occurs

fields.description:
I am using the jelly runner to create issues and I get a strange error message from the jelly runner. It told me that the create failed while it works.

Jelly script
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue duplicateSummary="ignore" project-key="XXX" assignee="XXX" summary="XXX" priority="5" type="1" description="">
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>

I get the following error message
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>((summary=Headset SC3/PS2)(type=1)(description=)(duplicateSummary=ignore)(project-key=XXX)(assignee=XXX)(pid=10110)(priority=5))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=XXX</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>Unknown Priority "5". Known values are : [3][5][2][4][1]</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly>

I tried it with different priority and it works. The issue is created and the priority is good.
fields.summary: createIssue print error message on priority attribute while there's no problem

fields.description: As an german company we would like to change in the look and feel section the time format from AM/PM to a 24 hours timing. Is it possible to change this with a view steps?
fields.summary: Time Format without AM/PM

fields.description:
Need to display a better error message.

The exception looks like this:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.SinglePluginLoader.loadPlugins(SinglePluginLoader.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.SinglePluginLoader.getPlugins(SinglePluginLoader.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.init(DefaultPluginManager.java:31)

	at com.atlassian.jira.ComponentManager.start(ComponentManager.java:194)

	at com.caucho.server.http.Application.init(Application.java:1843)
	at com.caucho.server.http.VirtualHost.init(VirtualHost.java:728)
	at com.caucho.server.http.ServletServer.initHosts(ServletServer.java:874)
	at com.caucho.server.http.ServletServer.initInternal(ServletServer.java:719)
	at com.caucho.server.http.ServletServer.init(ServletServer.java:530)

fields.summary: If a plugin descriptor is missing the 'key' attribute a NullPointerException is thrown.

fields.description: The files needed to get JIRA up and running on Ingres are including in the attached archive.
fields.summary: Support Ingres database

fields.description:
When some issues's comment or description contains "]]>", 
the xml file that JIRA automatic backup can't be imported.

I found the xml file's format is not correct, I have to modify manual like this:

<description>Data]]>Data2</description> 

------> 

<description>Data]]]]><![CDATA[>Data2</description> 



And this problem only occur in jira 3.0, JIRA 2.6 is OK.
fields.summary: Import Data Error

fields.description: The path to attachments can be recorded in the CSV file. The importer can tehn grab the file(s) and attach it to the relevant issue.
fields.summary: Extend CSV importer to import attachments

fields.description:
This issue materialises as JRA-6080 - where the selected component is lost once the search request is viewwed.

The selectmultiple.jsp "is selected" test fails if the iterator is working with Long objects. As the current jsp is written, the iterator requires strings in order for the equality test to succeed.

This occurred afterthe upgrade with the webwork jar.

There are three alternatives:

1. Ensure strings are always passed into this iterator.
2. Set the parameter value in a webwork property and then test against that value - e.g.:

<webwork:property value="{parameters['listKey']}" >
		    <option value="<webwork:property value="."/>"<webwork:if test="parameters['nameValue']"><webwork:iterator value="parameters['nameValue']"><webwork:if test=". == .."> SELECTED</webwork:if></webwork:iterator></webwork:if>>
        </webwork:property>

3. Check what changed with webwork!
fields.summary: Webwork: Selected test in "selectmultiple.jsp" template fails with Long objects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6146].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 Dec 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

If issue locking is critical for your environment, there are alternatives;
* [JIRA-Issue-Edit-Lock|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.koncis.atlassian.jira-issue-edit-lock].
* There's also a non-supported plugin which may solve your immediate needs: [whoslookin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.whoslookin]. This add-on is 6.x compatible and we're looking at the effort required to make this 7.x compatible. There is now also a cloud version of this plugin: [whoslookin for cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/whoslooking-connect/cloud/overview]
 
Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
oruettinger@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

\\

*Original description below:*
This can be implemented in 2 stages:

1. A simpler approach that detects that an issue has been edited and displays an error message informing the user of this fact. For example, a user clicks edit issue and takes their time to update a few fields. Another user updates the issue in the mean time. When the first user presses "Update" they will be returned to the Edit Issue screen with all the fields populated with values that were submitted by the user. The screen will display an error message informing the user than an issue has changed. The error message will also contain a link that will open a new browser window displaying the issue as it appears currently.

The user will be able to compare the issue using the View Issue screen in the second browser window and the Edit Issue screen. The system will not provide an indication on what fields are "clashing". The Edit Issue screen will contain a confirm button, that when pressed will do the check again, to ensure the issue has not changed since, and if it has not, will update the issue.

Issues will also be checked for updates during Bulk Edit operation. The Bulk Edit operation will not update any issues that have been updated in the mean time and will inform the user about these issues. (The user will then be able to bulk edit those issues if required).

When an issue is being progressed through workflow (e.g Resolved, Closed) a check will also be performed. If the issue has been changed the user will be informed of this fact. If the Workflow Transition that the user is trying to perform is still available the user will be provided with a link that will open the View Issue screen in another browser window. The user will be able to confirm that they would like to proceed. If the workflow operation is no longer available, the user will be asked to return to the View Issue screen.

We estimate the effort required to implement the above functionality to be around 80 man hours (or 2 man weeks).

2. The second approach takes the "issue locking" functionality a bit further and when a clash is detected during the Edit Issue stage, the user is presented with a page that shows the conflicts. The page shows the fields that are "different" in value between the current issue and the values that are being submitted by the user. For each "clashing" field the issue's current field value is shown as well as the submitted value. For each field the user will be able to specify the value that they actually would like to go ahead with and then proceed with the update.

The Bulk Edit will still leave modified issues untouched and will simply report them, just like in the first approach.

Progressing issue through workflow will use the Edit Issue's approach and show a conflict resolution screen if the workflow transition is still available.
fields.summary: Implement issue locking
Fix Websphere and weblogic problems with webwork

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6142].
  {panel}

This enhancement request is relevant for Jira instances that are "Private"

When a user clicks on an issue link in a notification email (or some other source) such as http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5595, and they are not already logged in, they are brought to a page that says:

You are not logged in.
You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must login or signup for an account.
If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 

The user then has to click on _login_ and then type in user/password.

This scenario is repeated over and over again in our system, since our users do not stay logged in to Jira.

We could save them a whole page view if they were simply redirected to the login page with the added the message on the top of the login page.  Conversely, adding a user/passwd login form to this page would be equally usefull.
fields.summary: Eliminate the " You are not logged in." page

fields.description:
When attaching a screenshot to an issue, the user is allowed to enter anything for the filename. If the name happens to include certain, "special characters" this has far reaching implications. 

Case 1: Name has the colon character e.g. "Screenshot1:The login page" 
This is an invalid file name on Windows. What happens is that Jira makes a record in the appropriate table in the database that this issue has an attachment by storing the name of the file. However, the actual attachment never got saved to the \attachmentsdir\issue-number directory. The reason as noted is because a file name of "Screenshot1:The login page" is a no-no per Windows. 

This results in a broken image icon for the thumbnail and an error when clicking on the thumbnail 

Case 2: Name has a percent character e.g. "Item page for 20% discount" 
The percent character has a special meaning when used in a URL. When a user tries to retrieve an attachment named thusly it spawns a thread in the app server that hangs forever. Typical user reaction when not getting a response is to repeat the request -- creating another thread. Ad infinitum. 

I think these problems can be prevented by enforcing OS-driven and HTTP-driven naming restrictions.
fields.summary: Screenshot attachment allows invalid characters -- Leads to downstream problems

fields.description:
When the following conditions are met:
  * Idle-session expiration is enabled (I get automatically logged out after a some period of time)
  * Such an amount of time has elapsed
  * I have a jira incident open in my browser

And I do the following:
  * Click Resolve Issue in the left bar

Then:
  * I get a system error. (bummer!, but of course logging in fixes the problem)

Other links:
  * Assign: System Error
  * Attach File: Permissions
  * Screenshot: window comes up OK, did not try to attach
  * Clone: Sysem Error
  * Comment: Permission error 
  * Create sub-task: Not-logged-in message (yeah!)
  * Delete: Permissions Error
  * Edit: System Error
  * Link: Permissions Error
  * Move: System Error
  * Vote: System Error
  * Watching: System Error

I believe that all links should return a "not-logged-in" message.

Thanks!
Darren.

Some additional details:
URL: http://HOST/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa?id=10030&action=5
Referer URL: http://HOST/browse/INCIDENT
fields.summary: Session Expiration and Resolve Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6137].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 July 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.

We have analysed the use case and feedback related to it coming to Atlassian from different directions. We recognise the importance of this feature request, but it is not something we will be able to devote development time to. Therefore this suggestion will be closed.

There are alternative solutions available on [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] which you should consider:
 * [Tempo Timesheets for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/is.origo.jira.tempo-plugin] available for both Cloud and Server deployments
 * [JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira-timesheet-plugin] available for Server deployments
 * [Minyaa Suite|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira.plugin.minyaa] available for Server deployments.

Thanks for your feedback and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
 Bartek
 JIRA Product Management
 bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description:*

It would be great to add a worklog report by user and/or by project. Right now, there's no search filter to do this. For example in time and date search category, add something like "Work logged in previous" "Work logged after", Work logged before"
 Also, a Excel report such as suggested in [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1781] could be interesting to.
fields.summary: Generate worklog report
Project Category Select Box on Issue Create

fields.description: It would be very useful if it where possible to query on any user who has updated a call
fields.summary: query on any users who have updated a call

fields.description:
When using custom fields, left pane gets extremely wide if you have a custom field that has longer description.

The problem lies in the ugly HTML that says:

[...snip...]
<td nowrap>
[.../snip...]

That way the text does not break into multiple lines and you get a really wide (3/4 of screen, depends on the lenght of your description) left pane and there's almost no room left for the actual isues.

Quick fix: add this CSS:

.subText {
        word-wrap: normal;           /* Internet Explorer */
        white-space: normal;         /* Firefox */
        white-space: -moz-pre-wrap;  /* Other Mozilla, since 1999 */
        white-space: pre-wrap;       /* css-3 */
        white-space: -pre-wrap;      /* Opera 4-6 */
        white-space: -o-pre-wrap;    /* Opera 7 */
        display: block;
}

This allows the description to wrap.


Actual fix would be to tidy up the HTML of the whole Jira and maybe even make it XHTML 1.0 compliant...
fields.summary: Left pane in "Find issues" is waaay to wide with custom fields having long descriptions
Glue SOAP clients throw UnMarshallException for RemoteIssue type
Services should be scheduled to run at fixed times, not after a delay
Backport ww plugin code fix

fields.description:
Simple python XML-RPC client:

#!/usr/bin/python

import xmlrpclib

s = xmlrpclib.Server('http://<jirahostname>/rpc/xmlrpc')
tok = s.jira1.login(['username', 'password'])
print tok
s.jira1.logout(tok)

I get this traceback below.  I have atlassian-jira-rpc-plugin-1.4.jar in my atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib directory and the RPC plugin is enabled (as well as the Accept API calls setting).  What am I missing?



Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./rpc.py", line 6, in ?
    tok = s.jira1.login(['sleach', 'wiggum19'])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/xmlrpclib.py", line 821, in __call__
    return self.__send(self.__name, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/xmlrpclib.py", line 975, in __request
    verbose=self.__verbose
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/xmlrpclib.py", line 853, in request
    return self.parse_response(h.getfile())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/xmlrpclib.py", line 896, in parse_response
    return u.close()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/xmlrpclib.py", line 571, in close
    raise apply(Fault, (), self._stack[0])
xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: com.atlassian.jira.rpc.xmlrpc.JiraXmlRpcService.login(java.util.Vector)'>
fields.summary: XML-RPC error

fields.description: Tracker has so many screens, some of them partly blank, space on screens is used not always rationally, but information displayd on some screens is often very limited. In the same time part of statistics is displayed on working screens instead of status reports. I have a feeling that operability and usability of JIRA Tracker may be significantly improved.
